intro: Anthemis aucheri, commonly known as the French chamomile, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features linear, gray-green leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The essential oil extracted from its flowers is used in aromatherapy and herbal remedies.
